channel.title: Running Windows 3.1 in a Virtual Machine
channel.description:
Yes, I made this guide myself. :D [b]Step 1: Installing Virtual PC[/b] Download VPC for free from [url=http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=6D58729D-DFA8-40BF-AFAF-20BCB7F01CD1&displaylang=en]http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=6D58729D-DFA8-40BF-AFAF-20BCB7F01CD1&displaylang=en[/url] NOTE: You must be running Windows 2000 or higher to install Virtual PC. (It has been free for a few weeks now, Microsoft announced it recently.) Unzip it and install it. [b]Step 2: Getting the Windows 3.1 Virtual Machine[/b] I downloaded a torrent for the Virtual HD from demonoid.com. You can download it from [url=http://www.demonoid.com/files/details/398490/1132698/]http://www.demonoid.com/files/details/398490/1132698/[/url] (I take no responsibility for that torrent, I didn't make it) If nobody is seeding the torrent then I will seed it myself or upload it to rapidshare. [b]Step 3: Preparing the Virtual Machine for use[/b] After the downloading is complete, open up the folder where the downloaded torrent files are stored, unrar Windows 3.11.rar, and double click on Windows 3.11.vmc. [b]Step 4: Using Windows 3.11/MSDOS[/b] The VM will start and you will see an MS-DOS prompt in the Virtual PC screen. Type in "WIN" or "WIN.COM" to start Windows 3.1 (Windows 3.1 may freeze/hang during loading periodically, and all you'll see is the splash screen, if that happens just restart the VM). The MS/Networking password/username is DEMONOID. Using Windows 3.1 from there on is pretty easy. [b]Here are some things you might want to know:[/b] [b]Automatically start Windows 3.1 without typing "WIN" or "WIN.COM" at the MSDOS prompt:[/b] Restart the Virtual Machine and when it says "TYPE "WIN" TO START WINDOWS, PASSWORD / LOGIN DEMONOID, instead of typing "WIN" type EDIT AUTOEXEC.BAT and press Enter. A blue screen will come up displaying the contents of AUTOEXEC.BAT. Create a new line after the "ECHO TYPE WIN TO START WINDOWS" line and type in:
WIN.COM
You can turn it off by removing that line from AUTOEXEC.BAT within Windows using notepad. [b]Internet Explorer:[/b] Its not a good idea to use Internet Explorer within Windows 3.1. First of all, many sites (including this one) will cause IE to crash because its such an old version and the page is incompatible. Secondly, this old version of IE is far more insecure than IE today. The chances of your VM getting infected with trojans and the like are pretty high. There is an alternative browser that you can use instead of IE for the VM, download it from http://home.arachne.cz/ Thanks to PaulT for pointing that out If there's any more questions please let me know.

WIN.COM

Its not a good idea to use Internet Explorer within Windows 3.1. First of all, many sites (including this one) will cause IE to crash because its such an old version and the page is incompatible. Secondly, this old version of IE is far more insecure than IE today. The chances of your VM getting infected with trojans and the like are pretty high.
